instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.BKLT_EN_R: What is BKLT_EN_R? This signal enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKL” before “_EN”. “BKL” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. The “_R” suffix means that the signal is asserted when it is high, as in 3.3v, which is the opposite of the “_L”  suffix.
definitions.EDP_BKLT_PWM: What is EDP_BKLT_PWM? EDP_BKLT_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKL_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight boost.
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight.
liquid damage at <TRANSISTOR>Q7701</TRANSISTOR>. shorted inside the board at <SIGNAL>PPVIN_SW_LCDBKLT_SW</SIGNAL>, so i dig out the short, now resistance is good at 0.4kohm
fuse is good 12.6v at both side
ppvout is 12.6v at pin 1 of lvds connector.
i have <SIGNAL>BKLT_EN_R</SIGNAL> 3.3v
I use known good must be working 2015 lcd.
I have tried replacing <TRANSISTOR>Q7701</TRANSISTOR> <TRANSISTOR>Q7700</TRANSISTOR>
need some pointer at why the output doesnt boost. any help appreciated, thank you..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight boost.
threads.message: Do you have continuity between <DIODE>D7710</DIODE> and <RESISTOR>R7731</RESISTOR>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight boost.
threads.message: yes its connected. 0.1 ohm resistance, so good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight boost.
threads.message: I found that <SIGNAL>LCDBKLT_FET_DRV_R</SIGNAL> doesnt have any voltage, is that normal ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight boost.
threads.message:
Just to confirm, do you get image, but no backlight?

Are you sure no more damage in the burnt area?
You may need to change LCD connector.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight boost.
threads.message:
Yep absolutely sure theres an apple logo there, i get usb activity too.
The liquid damage  i found is only that short i dig out.
Im a bit concern maybe theres some line didnt reach it destination maybe cut out by the traces i dig?
I will try to change lvds, even thought it looks good

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight boost.
threads.message: Check all traces continuity in the backlight circuitry.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight boost.
threads.message:
i have changed lvds connector, still same.
diode mode at lvds : 
1 : 0.400
2 : nc
3 : 0.464
4 : 0.464
5 : 0.525
6 : 0.640
7: 0.610
8: 0.510
9: 0.730 
10: 0.430

<CHIP>U7700</CHIP> have continuity from their pin to their surrounding component.
scl and sda line from <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> have continuity to lvds connector.
what voltages supposed to be on pin 1 of <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> ? its cycling with 1.2v at peak.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight boost.
threads.message:
Pins 1/2 and 4 controls <TRANSISTOR>Q7701</TRANSISTOR>.
Be sure <RESISTOR>R7731</RESISTOR>-33 are all good, as their traces too.
Backlight level is adjusted through I2C bus; check voltage and diode mode to ground at SCL/SDA pins.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight boost.
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7731</RESISTOR>-33 is good resistance all according to schematic.
Diode mode both scl and sda is same, so its good 0.451,
Any chance <TRANSISTOR>Q7701</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7700</TRANSISTOR> kill each other? Should i replace at once ?
*update : <TRANSISTOR>Q7701</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7700</TRANSISTOR> replaced at once still not boosting.

threads.message:

<SIGNAL>EDP_BKL_EN</SIGNAL> is 3.3v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight boost.
threads.message: how do you measure a coil ? L7710 resistance is 0.1 ohm, is that good ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight boost.
threads.message:
Check <RESISTOR>R7744</RESISTOR>/45; <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> is correctlt powered up?
Just in case, replace <DIODE>D7710</DIODE> and L7710.

BTW, a big coil is pure short in ohm scale as normal.

threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7744</RESISTOR>/45 is 0 ohm resistance , normal
<CHIP>U7700</CHIP> is powered up 5v by vddd and vdda normally too.
<DIODE>D7710</DIODE> and l7710 replaced. no backlight still.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight boost.
threads.message:
53V, why???
Correct voltage is around 39V.
Higher volatge will mean no connection with LED strip.

I hope you've cheked all above with LCD connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight boost.
threads.message:
no.. i know 53v is without load, let me revise my question, what component turn that 12.3v to 39v ?
i have checked all my measurement with lcd connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight boost.
threads.message:
Backlight level is adjusted through I2C bus, is not just an enable signal required.
You must be sure to test with compatible (known good) screen.
PCH sends adjust signal (<SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_PWM</SIGNAL>) to LCD and this one will resend adjust to <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> via I2C bus.
